update.description:
This pulls out the changes to header files from pull request #88 and targets to `ign-physics1` to confirm that API and ABI are not affected by these changes. It requires [ign-plugin pr 32](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-plugin/pull-requests/32), which is also the ign-plugin 1.1.0~pre1 prerelease.

When testing with [release-tools branch physics_prerelease](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/release-tools/branch/physics_prerelease), the ubuntu and API/ABI build are happy:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_physics-abichecker-any_to_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64&build=98)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_physics-abichecker-any_to_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/98/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_physics-abichecker-any_to_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/98/
* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_physics-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64&build=328)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_physics-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/328/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_physics-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/328/

I expect that this branch won't have the speed-up; this is just for reviewing API/ABI compatibility. I'll make a subsequent PR targeted to this branch that should demonstrate the speedup.

rebuilding with that gazebodistro branch:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ign_physics-pr-win&build=394)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_physics-pr-win/394/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_physics-pr-win/394/

that build failed, but I've confirmed on my local machine that the windows build will pass with Visual Studio 2019. So I think we should install VS 2019 on our windows CI machine, and then we should be able to start merging this

content.raw:
There’s a huge dump of really bizarre compilation errors. I’ll need to cobble together a Windows environment to debug on, which may take some time. I’ll try to have this sorted out early next week.

One possibility is that MSVC just isn’t parsing it correctly. Maybe [using the Clang frontend](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/cppblog/use-any-c-compiler-with-visual-studio/) would be enough to fix this. I’m not sure if that’s something we could configure through cmake.
content.html:
There’s a huge dump of really bizarre compilation errors. I’ll need to cobble together a Windows environment to debug on, which may take some time. I’ll try to have this sorted out early next week.

One possibility is that MSVC just isn’t parsing it correctly. Maybe using the Clang frontend would be enough to fix this. I’m not sure if that’s something we could configure through cmake.

content.raw:
@{557058:67759e29-d1df-465f-868d-047738e36fc9} the windows build for this branch is failing; the following is the first error that I see

~~~
# when building test/plugins/MockJoints
detail/FeatureList.hh(545): error C3546: '...': there are no parameter packs available to expand
~~~

I tried also with the `improve_compile_times` branch of pull request #88 and it also fails

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ign_physics-pr-win&build=332)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_physics-pr-win/332/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_physics-pr-win/332/
